message_1: Suppose you want to encode the message "HELLO" using a one-time pad encryption where the key is "WORLD". What is the encoded message? (Hint: The letters can be converted to numerical values where A=0, B=1, C=2, and so on.)
message_2:
To encode the message "HELLO" using a one-time pad encryption with the key "WORLD", we first convert the letters to their numerical values:

HELLO: 7 4 11 11 14
WORLD: 22 14 17 11 3

Next, we add the corresponding numerical values of the message and the key modulo 26 (since there are 26 letters in the alphabet):

(7+22) mod 26 = 29 mod 26 = 3
(4+14) mod 26 = 18 mod 26 = 18
(11+17) mod 26 = 28 mod 26 = 2
(11+11) mod 26 = 22 mod 26 = 22
(14+3) mod 26 = 17 mod 26 = 17

The encoded message in numerical values is: 3 18 2 22 17

Now, we convert these numerical values back to letters:

3=D, 18=S, 2=C, 22=W, 17=R

So, the encoded message is "DSCWR".
